docs.title: Vivek Kumar
docs.text:
Most of my time on this planet has gone into telling computer systems how to behave — making them run efficiently and reliably for humans.

A few years in Industry, I realized humans are far more complex than machines. Since then, I’ve been exploring psychology, history, business, and anything else that sparks curiosity.

That doesn’t mean I’ve left tech — it’s still my first love and how I pay the bills.

I often publish, satirical pieces(in form of writing and video) about technology, human behavior, and whatever else catches my attention.

If that sounds interesting, subscribe to my Social — I promise it’ll be worth your time.

I also run WeeklyTechFax (WTF) — a weekly newsletter for deep tech enthusiasts where I send top industry tech happenings straight to your inbox. Read before you susbscribe →

Know More about me: vivekk.tech/me

docs.title: Vivek Kumar
docs.text: Software Engineer - Site Reliability @ LinkedIn Bangalore Urban, Karnataka, India

docs.title: 🎤 Keynote Speaker | International Conference on Digitization & BlockChain
B.Tech Computer Science | Haldia Institute of Technology
Higher Secondary (Science) | Guru Gobind Singh Public School
WeeklyTechFax (WTF)
docs.text:
Welcome to the first issue of WeeklyTechFax (WTF).

Let me set the expectations clearly.

This newsletter curates the most important tech happenings of the week — product launches, outages, engineering blogs, research breakthroughs, and tools worth your attention — delivered in a concise, signal-first format.

The goal is simple:

So you don't have to scan dozens of tabs, timelines, and feeds.

I know you don't have time to read everything. You're not supposed to.

Instead, block 15 minutes on your calendar — after standup, before deep work, or whenever your mind is sharp — and go through one piece that genuinely interests you. One insight at a time.

Over weeks and months, that compounds.

If this newsletter does its job well, you'll be 1% more informed every week.

And that adds up.

If you'd like to suggest high-quality blogs, tools, or research, feel free to 📧 Email me.

If this journal was forwarded to you, thank the friend who sent it — and subscribe here to get future issues directly in your inbox.

Let's build clarity together.

— Vivek

Read previous publications →
